intro: Anisomeris brachypoda, commonly known as the narrowleaf dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant has alternate, narrow, and often hairy leaves, with a short stem that supports its bright yellow composite flowers. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in desert or semi-desert environments. Anisomeris brachypoda is adapted to arid conditions, with a deep root system that helps it conserve water.
